alert.note: Alert for Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Wayne, southwestern Laurel, southeastern Pulaski, central McCreary and northwestern Whitley Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Coopersville, or 8 miles southeast of Monticello, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Slavens and Gregory around 445 PM EDT. Denney, Ritner and Delta around 450 PM EDT. Wiborg, Kidder and Quinton around 455 PM EDT. Greenwood, Alpine, Parkers Lake, Sloans Valley, Beulah Heights and Tateville around 500 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Honeybee, Cumberland Falls S.P., Huxley, Baldrock, Rockcastle Springs, Holly Bay Rec. Area, Mount Victory, Bark Camp, Grove, Vox and Rye. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for south central Kentucky.
